text: 学習してるってことか / N2航空爆雷も効果ありません
translation: So it's learning? / The N2 aerial depth charges have no effect either.
grammar: ってことか - casual way of confirming understanding, short for ということか (so that means...?)

text: 以後使徒の消息は不明です / 来るわね多分 / 次はここに
translation: After that, the Angel's whereabouts are unknown. / It's probably coming. / Next time, here.
grammar: 来るわね - feminine sentence ending わね adds softness and seeking agreement

text: 本体ごとね。その時は、第三足の子の誕生かしら?
translation: Along with its main body. When that happens, will it be the birth of the Third Impact?
grammar: かしら - feminine wondering/questioning particle, softer than かな

text: 富士五湖が一つになって、太平洋と繋がるわ。本部ごとね。 / 光司令は?
translation: The Five Lakes of Fuji will become one and connect to the Pacific Ocean. Along with headquarters. / What about Commander Ikari?
grammar: 一つになって - te-form showing sequential action (become one, then connect)

text: 使徒の放つ強力なジャミングのため、連絡不能です。 / マギの判断は? / 前回一致で撤退を推奨しています。 / どうするの?今の責任者はあなたよ。
translation: Due to the powerful jamming emitted by the Angel, communication is impossible. / What's MAGI's judgment? / It unanimously recommends retreat. / What will you do? You're the one in charge now.
grammar: のため - because of, due to (formal causal expression)

text: 日本政府各省に通達。NERV権限における特別宣言D17。
translation: Notification to all Japanese government ministries. Special Declaration D-17 under NERV authority.
grammar: における - formal expression meaning 'in, under, regarding' (used in official/written contexts)

text: 半径50キロ以内の全市民は直ちに避難 / 松城にはマギのバックアップを頼んで / ここを放棄するんです / か? / いいえ、ただ、みんなで危ない橋を渡ることはないわ
translation: All citizens within a 50km radius evacuate immediately. / Request MAGI backup from Matsushiro. / Are you abandoning this place? / No, but there's no need for everyone to take unnecessary risks.

vocabulary.reading: あぶないはしをわたる
vocabulary.meaning: to take risks, cross a dangerous bridge

grammar: ことはない - there's no need to (negative necessity expression)

text: 政府による特別宣言D17が発令されました
translation: Special Declaration D-17 has been issued by the government.
grammar: による - passive agent marker in formal contexts (by the government)

text: 市民の皆様は速やかに指定の場所へ避難してください
translation: All citizens, please evacuate promptly to the designated locations.
grammar: てください - polite request form used in public announcements

text: 第6・第7ブロックを優先に各区長の指示に従い / 速やかに移動をお願いいたします
translation: Prioritizing Blocks 6 and 7, please follow your district chief's instructions and move promptly.
grammar: お願いいたします - humble/polite request form (more formal than ください)

text: 市内における避難はすべて完了
translation: All evacuation within the city is complete.
grammar: における - formal locative expression meaning 'within, in' (formal/written style)

text: 部内警報シーンによる非先導員およびD級勤務者の退避完了しました
translation: Evacuation of non-essential personnel and D-level workers per internal alert is complete.
grammar: および - formal conjunction meaning 'and' used in official/written language

text: やるの本気で / ええそうよ / あなたの勝手な判断でエヴァを3体とも捨てる気
translation: Are you serious about this? / Yes, I am. / You're going to discard all three Evas based on your own arbitrary judgment?
grammar: 気 (き) - at the end indicates intention or mood (捨てる気 = intending to discard)

translation: The chance of success is 0.00001%.

vocabulary.meaning: success rate (in this context, likely 勝算)

grammar: Simple statement of probability using percentage

text: 万に一つもないのよ / ゼロではないわ / エヴァにかけるだけよ / カツラギさんさ
translation: There's not even a one in ten thousand chance! / It's not zero. / I'm just betting on Eva.
grammar: 万に一つもない - idiomatic expression meaning 'not even one in ten thousand' (extremely unlikely)

text: 現責任者は私です
translation: I am the current person in charge.
grammar: 現 prefix attached to nouns to mean 'current' or 'present'

text: やることはやっときたいの / 使徒殲滅は私の仕事です / 仕事? / 笑わせるわね / 自分のためでしょ / あなたの使徒への復讐は
translation: I want to do what needs to be done. / Destroying Angels is my job. / Job? / Don't make me laugh. / It's for yourself, isn't it? / Your revenge against the Angels.
grammar: やっときたい - やっておきたい contracted, meaning 'want to do in advance/preparation'

text: えぇー / 手で受け止める / そう
translation: What?! / Catch it with our hands. / That's right.

vocabulary.meaning: to catch, to receive, to stop

grammar: で particle indicating means/method (手で = by hand, with hands)

text: 落下予測地点にエヴァを配置 / ATフィールド最大であなたたちが直接使徒を受け止めるのよ / 使徒がコースを大きく外れたら / その時はアウト / 機体が衝撃に耐えられなかったら
translation: Position the Evas at the predicted fall point. / With AT Fields at maximum, you'll directly catch the Angel. / What if the Angel goes far off course? / Then we're out. / What if the units can't withstand the impact?
grammar: たら - conditional form (if/when something happens)

text: その時もアウトね / 賞賛は / 神のみぞ知るといったところかしら
translation: Then we're out too. / The odds are... / Only God knows, I suppose.
grammar: 神のみぞ知る - classical expression 'only God knows' (みぞ is emphatic classical particle)

text: これでうまくいったらまさに奇跡ね / 奇跡ってのは起こしてこそ初めて価値が出るものよ / つまり何とかしてみせろってこと
translation: If this works, it'll be a miracle. / A miracle only has value when you make it happen. / In other words, make it work somehow.
grammar: てこそ - emphasizes that only by doing X does Y result (miracles only gain value when made to happen)

text: すまないけど他に方法がないの / この作戦は / 作戦と言えるのこれが
translation: I'm sorry, but there's no other way. / This operation... / Can you even call this an operation?
grammar: と言える - potential form meaning 'can be called' or 'can say that'

text: ほんと言えないわね / だから嫌なら辞退できるわ
translation: You really can't call it that. / So if you don't want to, you can decline.
grammar: なら - conditional 'if' often used for hypothetical situations

text: みんないいのね
translation: Everyone's okay with this, right?
grammar: のね - sentence ending seeking confirmation (softer than のか)

text: 一応規則だと / 衣装を書くことになってるけど / どうする / 別にいいわ / そんなつもりないもの / 私もいい / 必要ないもの / 僕もいいです
translation: According to regulations... / You're supposed to write a will, but... / What will you do? / I'm fine without it. / I have no intention of dying. / Me too. / I don't need one either. / I'm fine too.

vocabulary.meaning: will, testament (likely meant instead of 衣装)

grammar: ことになっている - expresses established rules or customs (supposed to, expected to)

text: すまないわね / 終わったらみんなにステーキをおごるから / え?本当? / 約束する / はーい / 忘れないでよ / 期待してて
translation: Sorry about this. / When it's over, I'll treat everyone to steak. / Really? / I promise. / Okay! / Don't forget! / Look forward to it.
grammar: てて - contracted form of ていて (期待していて = keep expecting/looking forward to)

text: ごちそうといえばステーキで決まりか / 今時の子供がステーキで喜ぶと思ってんのかしら / これだからセカンドインパクト世代って貧乏くさいのよね
translation: So when it comes to a feast, steak is the go-to? / Does she think kids these days get excited about steak? / This is why the Second Impact generation seems so cheap.
grammar: といえば - when it comes to, speaking of (topic introduction)
